scenario_text.value:
Are you still not ready to go? What’s taking
so long?
I’m working on letting everyone know.
Besides, you said you’d wait until noon.
I’d rather not be waiting at all!
And we all know that.
But don’t try to rush people too much.

You saw that thing last night too, didn’t
you?
That creepy monster with the weird hands?

After seein’ that thing, it’s no wonder the
others are scared. It sure freaked me out.

If the fog comes back, it might attack again.
You can see how that’d be upsetting, right?
Sure, but...couldn’t that happen to Miu too?

The fog could show up at any time, along with
that weird monster.

All that stuff with Ryo hit everyone harder
than I’d realized.
Makes sense to me.

They’ve probably all realized the same thing
could happen to any of them.

It’s not so easy to get over something like
that.

Until last night, none of us fully realized
just how dangerous this place could be.

(Probably, deep down, none of us thought we’d
actually die. We thought we’d be rescued.)

And Miu’s out there right now, on her own, in
a dangerous place like this.
Miu...
What am I doing? I don’t have time for this!

Hey, wait! Are you just going to go charging
out there again?

Think about what happened yesterday. We can’t
let the same thing happen to Miu!
So I’m going, even if it has to be alone!
It’s like you haven’t learned anything!
Kaito, wait!
No! I’ve waited long enough!

(This is bad! He might actually leave this
time. I need to convince him to stop!)

(But it has to be good, or he won’t listen.
Should I say we need his help too?)
(Or should I try to stop him by force?)
(How can I convince Kaito?)
Appeal for help!
Persuade him.
By force, if need be!

Kaito, if you go, you’re putting us in danger
too. Please, we need to stick together!

I don’t see what difference having one less
person in the group makes.

But wasn’t the whole problem yesterday that
we didn’t work together?
Uh... Well...

Besides, in a world where anything could
happen, we could use all the help we can get.

I don’t know, how much help do you think this
hothead could be?

He’s stubborn, short-tempered, and totally
focused on Miu.
Shut up!

Look, the important thing is we shouldn’t
split up.
Kaito, please.

Oh, all right, fine. You don’t have to beg me
like that.

Besides, I guess having more help looking for
Miu WOULD make things easier.
Thanks, Kaito.
Yeah. Sure.
Oh, what’s this? Your face is turning red.
It is not!
It’s like I said before.

Anything could happen out there. I can’t let
you go on your own. It’s not safe.
I can take care of myself, okay?
Besides, I’ll have Dracmon with me.

(It sounds like Kaito trusts Dracmon more
than I realized.)

(But wait, that’s a problem. If that’s how he
feels, how can I convince him to stay?)

You should know, Kaito, I’m with Takuma on
this one.

What?! I thought you said before you’d come
with me!

Only as a last resort if you rush out of
here.

Besides, you never know what you’ll find when
you’re looking for Miu. Better to have help.
Yeah, sure, but...

(Looks like Kaito is starting to calm down
again thanks to Dracmon.)
(One more point might do it.)

Kaito, think of how Miu would feel if
anything were to happen to you.
All right, fine!

Besides, I did say I’d wait until noon.
Leaving before then really wouldn’t be right.
Exactly! That’s some good thinking, for you.
Hey! You didn’t have to add that!
No! I’m not letting you go!
I’ll keep you here by force if I have to.
What? You think you can stop me?!

(Uh...to be honest, I don’t think I can. But
still...)

If it means keeping you here, I’m not going
to hold back.

Damn it! Why are you so desperate to stop me,
anyway?
Isn’t it obvious?

Because I want us all to work together to
find Miu, then go back home.

And the only way to make that happen is to
cooperate, so...

If you’re so set on this, let’s go together.
Don’t you think that’s the smart thing to do?
What Takuma’s saying makes sense to me.
I know that, okay? I’m not stupid.
Let’s all work together to find Miu.
...You’re right, Takuma. Thanks.

I’m sorry, Takuma. Kaito tends to act without
thinking.
Oh, shut up!
Anyway, look, uh...
Thanks, Takuma.
